channel.title: Need help with PI Source Drop Rates
channel.description:
#general graardor 6260:25 829:1 391:2 385:2 564:50 1249:1 3052:3 892:75 1303:1 808:100 1602:3 1917:1 1971:1 1514:16 1319:1 1275:1 3024:3 1606:3 454:150 560:100 563:50 561:75 1373:1 1127:1 5300:2 2440:3 1604:3 1452:1 995:100000 1149:1 830:5 1079:1 886:100 1608:3 11712:1 11728:1 11714:1 11724:1 11704:1 11710:1 989:1
This is for bandos. Iv heard the first number is the ID for the monster, Second is the ratio of drop percentages. Afterwards its item:itemamount..
But if i wanted to make an item like 4 percent drop rate and another item 12 percent drop rate how would i do that? like this?
6260:4 995:100000 6260:12 995:10000
?? Help please.

item.title: Need help with PI Source Drop Rates
item.dc:creator: @deans1243 deans1243
item.description:
@deans1243 wrote:

To be honest im not sure you can do that since the second line would be constants (unless constants are through the tsm file) if they are through that then i think the second line would just be more regular drops but there is only 1 ratio for drop rarity so i dont think you can have different items drop more or less frequently.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with PI Source Drop Rates

item.description:
@giveitup wrote:

alright il try it and let you know how it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with PI Source Drop Rates
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I don’t remember, but can’t you just add a whole new #general graardor line and change the ratio? Try that, but I really don’t have much of an idea. It’s been awhile since I even looked at PI.

Read full topic

#general graardor

11712:1 11728:1 11714:1 11724:1 11704:1 11710:1 989:1

This is for bandos. Iv heard the first number is the ID for the monster, Second is the ratio of drop percentages. Afterwards its item:itemamount…

But if i wanted to make an item like 4 percent drop rate and another item 12 percent drop rate how would i do that? like this?

6260:4 995:100000
6260:12 995:10000

?? Help please.
